main event: An unidentified flying object was reported over Tierra Amarilla, New Mexico on 25 May 1952, potentially traversing at high speeds and identified through radar.
interesting points: The object was observed on radar as three fires on two scopes., One pilot reported a circular yellow object traveling at estimated speeds of 600 to 1,000 mph., The radar contact was maintained as the object moved at various speeds before disappearing., It was reported that the observations of the target warranted further scrutiny as a possible unidentified aerial object., The reliability of the airmen involved in the sighting was considered trustworthy.
witness description: airmen considered reliable and trustworthy in performance of their duties
